properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall and strong winds are expected. Time span: Wednesday night until Friday morning. Locations: Rigolet to Hopedale. Total snowfall: 10 to 20 cm, with locally higher amounts possible. Maximum wind gusts: northerly 80 km/h. Remarks: Snow spreading northward over Labrador will reach the Rigolet area around midnight Wednesday night and areas further north later in the night. The snow is is expected to taper to flurries by midday Thursday in the Rigolet area, but will continue through Thursday night into Friday morning over areas further north. Strong north to northeasterly winds will accompany the snow, resulting in reduced visibilities in blowing snow. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-04T20:15:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-04T04:16:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1644163524.2020
Area: Rigolet and vicinity, Postville - Makkovik, Hopedale and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds expected today, tonight and Thursday. Maximum gusts: southwesterly 80 to 100 km/h. Locations: Eastern Newfoundland including the northern Avalon Peninsula. Time span: overnight tonight until near noon Thursday. Remarks: Strongest wind gusts are expected along exposed areas of the coast. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-05T00:54:36-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-04T08:55:36-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0463383999.2020
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, St. John's and vicinity, Bonavista Peninsula, Clarenville and vicinity, Terra Nova
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rainfall, combined with melting snow, is expected. The frozen ground has a reduced ability to absorb this rainfall. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-05T00:56:50-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-04T08:56:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3993653662.2020
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, Avalon Peninsula Southeast, St. John's and vicinity, Avalon Peninsula Southwest, Burin Peninsula
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A fast moving cold front will track across parts of central and southern Alberta tonight. Along the front, gusty winds and heavy flurries will cause reduced visibility in snow and blowing snow. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-04T16:01:39-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-04T06:26:39-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4256050291.2020

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wintry weather expected. Time span: Wednesday afternoon until late Wednesday evening. Locations: Great Northern Peninsula. Snowfall and Ice pellet amounts: generally 2 to 4 cm. Potentially more than 10 cm near the Strait. Rainfall: generally 2 to 4 mm, potentially up to 10 mm in Green Bay - White Bay. Remarks: Snow and ice pellets are expected to develop Wednesday afternoon with possibly a significant period of freezing rain. The precipitation is expected to taper off to drizzle as temperatures rise above zero later in the evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-04T20:16:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-04T04:17:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1203142427.2020
Area: Green Bay - White Bay, Northern Peninsula East, Parson's Pond - Hawke's Bay, Port Saunders and the Straits
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall, strong winds and blowing snow are expected. Total snowfall: 15 cm or more. Maximum wind gusts: northeasterly 70 km/h. Locations: Happy Valley-Goose Bay to Cartwright and Black Tickle. Time span: Wednesday night through Thursday. Remarks: Snow will develop Wednesday night with strengthening northeasterly winds resulting in reduced visibilities in blowing snow. The snow and wind will gradually ease during the day on Thursday. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Winter storm watches are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-04T20:15:10-00:00

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills is expected. The coldest wind chill values will be near minus 55. These very cold wind chills will continue tonight and moderate late Wednesday morning. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Watch for cold related symptoms: shortness of breath, chest pain, muscle pain and weakness, numbness and colour change in fingers and toes. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-04T18:59:28-00:00

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy snowfall with blowing snow is expected. Significant snowfall, ice pellets, strong winds and blowing snow are expected. Total snow and ice pellet amounts: 15 to 25 cm. Maximum wind gusts: easterly 80 km/h. Locations: southeastern Labrador. Time span: early Wednesday evening until near midnight Wednesday night. Remarks: Snow mixed at times with ice pellets will develop Wednesday evening, with a risk of freezing rain over some areas. The snow is expected to be heavy, at times, and will be accompanied by strong winds resulting in poor visibility in blowing snow. The snow is forecast to change to a mixture of rain and snow near midnight, and to taper to flurries before morning on Thursday. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-04T20:14:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-04T04:15:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2415467277.2020
Area: Red Bay to L'Anse-au-Clair, Norman Bay to Lodge Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 20 cm continues. A strong Pacific cold front will bring heavy snow to the route tonight. The snow has started and as the front crosses the region tonight, the snow level will lower to near 400 metres. Total snowfall accumulations of up to 20 cm are expected by Wednesday morning. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-04T18:30:14-00:00

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall, strong winds, and localized blowing snow are expected. Total snowfall: 15 to 30 cm, with higher amounts possible over elevated terrain. Maximum wind gusts: southwesterly 100 km/h Locations: Burgeo and the west coast from Channel-Port aux Basques to Gros Morne. Time span: this evening until Thursday evening. Remarks: Rain is expected to develop this morning and change over to snow at times heavy this evening. Snow will be accompanied by strong southwesterly winds and blowing snow over exposed areas overnight. Blowing snow will become more widespread on Thursday along the west coast as temperatures dip below zero. Localized flooding may occur in low lying areas with the expected rain today. Where possible, ice and snow should be cleared from storm drains. ### Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Summary:

Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 15 cm is expected. A strong Pacific cold front will bring heavy snow to the route tonight. Snow will develop early this evening and become heavy at times near midnight. Total snowfall accumulations of up to 15 cm are expected by Wednesday morning. ### Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-04T16:59:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-04T01:01:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0305042194.2020
Area: Trans-Canada Highway - Eagle Pass to Rogers Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A major winter storm is expected. Total accumulations of snow reaching 25 to 40 centimetres are expected Wednesday into Thursday. Strong winds will locally cause blowing snow. These poor weather conditions could delay travel. Please consider modifying any non essential travel plans. ### Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Road closures are possible. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-04T20:00:50-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-04T04:01:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0301703067.2020
Area: Matane, Grande-Vall√©e area, Sainte-Anne-des-Monts area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Maximum gusts: southerly 80 km/h. except up to 110 km/h along parts of the coast. Locations: Connaigre, Burin Peninsula, and the southern Avalon Peninsula. Time span: late in the afternoon until this evening. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-05T00:51:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-04T08:52:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1619019050.2020
Area: Avalon Peninsula Southeast, Avalon Peninsula Southwest, Burin Peninsula, Connaigre
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rainfall, combined with melting snow, is expected. The frozen ground has a reduced ability to absorb this rainfall. Total rainfall: 15 - 25 mm Locations: Southern Newfoundland, from Channel-Port aux Basques to Connaigre Time span: this morning to this evening Remarks: Rain, at times heavy, will begin late this morning and continue through the day before changing to snow tonight. Snow will be at times heavy from Channel-Port aux Basques to Burgeo where winter storm warnings have been issued. Localized flooding may occur in low lying areas. Where possible, ice and snow should be cleared from storm drains in advance of the rainfall. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-05T00:47:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-04T08:48:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1300780189.2020
Area: Connaigre, Burgeo - Ramea, Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibilities due to snow and blowing snow are expected Wednesday afternoon and evening. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-04T19:59:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-04T04:00:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2409208476.2020
